result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Lawrence Freeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

14CM504, 15CM50 & 15CM96 Cases called @ 2:30 p.m. Defendant Brian Lawernce Freeman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Brian Lawernce Freeman in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM96 - Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CM50: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. 15CM96: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Repeater enhancer dismissed on 15CM50 - Ct 2 and 15CM96 - Ct 1. 14CM504 - DRI. 15TR214 - DRI. 15CM96: Ct 2  - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: 15CM50: Ct 1 - 58 days WCJ - 44 days CFTS - Time served sentence, $568 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CM50: Ct 2 - 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions - AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CM96: Ct 1 - 30 days WCJ concurrent with 15CM50 - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation concurrent with 15CM50 - Conditions - Same as 15CM50. Appeal rights given.
Moved Left No Address - Unable to Forward
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting P/S hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Brian Lawrence Freeman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi - DE is on a PO Hold - requesting lower cash bond or signature bond. Court orders $350 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 02:50 pm.
